Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Sleevo
Reviews.Content: No elevator to go up 4 flights of stairs with luggage. No lighting in rooms or halls. Breakfast very overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “good location, but bad service”
Reviews.Author: Monica A
Reviews.Content: receptionists are too confused, we discussed 3 times about the rates! we reserved on the internet but it was not prepaid. when we arrived we discovered they accepted only a very limited nr of credit cards (i.e. no electronic cards) so 2 of us had to withdraw cash on the following day to settle the bill. back to the hotel, the receptionist said the total was lower due to some deposit he had to give us back. we asked several times if he was sure about this and in the end he was almost annoyed by our insistence. when we left, 2 days later, they said the bill was not fully settled and wanted us to pay back the value of the "deposit"!

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel experience in years”
Reviews.Author: Lestos01
Reviews.Content: I would really suggest avoiding that hotel: for more than 100£ per night for a single room, you get a tiny room in the basement, with strong vanish smell, no light, hardly enough space to walk around the bed, more waves in the bed than in the sea, a miniscule shower room, and not even the possibility to get a breakfast if you need to leave early in the morning. Even the remote of the TV was not working! That was a terrible experience and I promissed myself never to return to that hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Stay in Paddington”
Reviews.Author: Sarah K
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel overnight with my daughter, whilst doing a bit of sightseeing + xmas shopping - found it very clean and very comfortable. The staff were all very helpful and very polite, great location for travelling to and from London as well as around London, would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay! No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: forces1
Reviews.Content: We booked last minute and having read the reviews were braced for a nightmare! But it was fabulous! Check in took seconds, we'd been given a club room in the basement instead of the deluxe but no problem! Room was large, bed comfy, shower a good size! There was no view but I wasn't in London to stay in the room and look out! Breakfast served till ten am meant a lie in! Excellent choice if breakfast- all the fry up essentials fresh and hot with a good choice of continental too! Would definitely stay again! Â£82 for a double room in London, with breakfast...... Nicer and cheaper than any travel lodge / premier inn!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jay B
Reviews.Content: The room is as big as our box bedroom, The tv took up all of the wall and was hanging over what can never be called a double bed. The room was like staying in a sauna the radiator wouldnt turn off so we had that on all night, the air-con wouldnt go less than 20 degrees that isnt aircon in my eyes, I tried opening the window it didnt stay up and slammed on my hand not a great start to the day!! The shower was a tight squeeze getting in and out and i'm hardly a big guy i really do feel for anyone who is abit overweight. I had a cleaner walk in on me starkers in the morning even though we put the notice on the door handle not to come in. We were thinking about having breakfast at the hotel but as we hadnt booked it rior to our visit it would of cost Â£17 i dont think so for abit of bacon!! Yes the hotel is very clean and modern looking but for the price i did at least expect a room i could move around in and be comfortable within. My only praise for the hotel is the staff were very friendly and helpful and we could leave our bags there while we had the day in london even after we had checked out. Jay and claire droitwich stayed 12-11-11 to 13-11-11

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, albeit small!”
Reviews.Author: sarahNorwich86
Reviews.Content: I was in "Paddington Court Rooms" and the room was tiny but modern, clean and comfortable. The tea and coffee facilities and toilettries are a nice addition, and unexpected given the price. There was a reasonably good choice available with the continental breakfast but it is a bit over priced. And there were no bed bugs despite other reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel in a good location. Wouldn't stay here if u can't carry your bag on a lot of stairs unless u call a bellboy!”
Reviews.Author: Ser579
Reviews.Content: Very small room and bathroom but quite a good hotel in terms of fittings etc. Double bed quite small but probably standard for here. Not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, had bedbugs and could hear the neighbours TV all through the night”
Reviews.Author: Chantelle B
Reviews.Content: I booked into the Best Western South Kensington hotel because there were no other places available as I left booking a hotel for the Wed 28 Sep 2011 to the day and had to pay 115 Pounds which is a LOT of money for me. When I arrived at the hotel, jet-lagged and sick they told me that because of electrical problems I had to go to the Best Westen Paddington Court hotel instead. They payed for a great cab and I didn't mind too much. At Paddington I was upgraded to a "Club Room" and whisked away to my room. When I finally got to bed dead tired at 3pm because of jet-lag I felt something biting me and started itching on my hand and back and pulled away the covers to see the black bedbugs running around in the bed. I immediately went down to reception to complain and show them my bites and tell them to close off the room. They offered me another room but they did not offer a partial refund of my room charge and didn't even offer to pay for any creams or medication that I needed for the swelling bites. (Which I still have 5 days later!) I was whisked off to another room that was a "club room" here I was met with a loud fridge that buzzed all night and didn't even have anything in it (a complete waste of electricity!) and the walls were so thin that I could not sleep because of my neighbors TV that was on the wall we shared. The reception staff were very nice and very quick to try and please and the breakfast and food was great but the protocols of the hotel ware flawed to the bone. I rate the following as TERRIBLE 1) Cleanliness 2) Sleep quality 3)Value I will never stay in a Best Western again.

Reviews.Title: “Scam - they overbook and ship you somewhere else. Plain fraud.”
Reviews.Author: Stevjoh
Reviews.Content: I can't review the hotel as I never got to stay - on arrival, despite booking and pre-paying on last minute.com, there were maintenance issues and I would have to stay at a sister hotel. While waiting for a taxi (complimentary) I googled the hotel and this doesn't seem to be an isolated incidence, rather a trend. I view it as fraud - they overbook the hotel and ship you elsewhere. To make things worse, the second hotel had no rooms either and I was shipped to a third. The systematic way this hotel group seems to go about overbooking reflects poorly on Best Western and Lastminute.com.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: scottishlass321
Reviews.Content: after travelling all day and arriving at the hotel at 1am (we did call in the morning to let them know we would be late) we went to check in, did the usual, gave name, reference and card details. we were then told there wasnt a room for us due to renovations, surely they would have known this when we booked the room or even in the morning when i called!! We were then told that we would have to take a taxi to a hotel 20mins away and return the next day, which was completely unaccpetable, we were only there for 3 night and that would mean having to swap hotels again!After 30mins of arguing he then agreed to put us in a different hotel for the full 3 nights. The hotel we ended up in was clean but tiny, we couldnt even open our suitcase on the floor because there wasnt enough room! Totally unacceptable, unprofessional and a rip off! I would warn anyone to steer clear from this hotel chain!

Reviews.Title: “clean, good service and staff but small room”
Reviews.Author: UkWhiskas
Reviews.Content: The room was very small and if you are more than an average size would recommend that you pay more for bigger one. The hotel was clean, good staff and seemed to be a lot of them. We had the breakfast as initially we thought to pricey but offer down to Â£11.95 - cooked, fresh fruit salad, cold meats and a good range of pastries so plenty to suit, all washed down with plenty of tea/coffee. Excellent location as we needed to have good access to Paddington station and this is just 10mins down the road, easy. Hotel will store you bags before check in and after checkout which meant we could make the most of London and pick up the bags and go straight to the station which was a real plus. We booked on a top secret deal so at the price we paid were very satsified.

Reviews.Title: “Bad...Very Bad”
Reviews.Author: Elwalsh
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner recently had a trip to London and were booked into the Best Western Kensington. When we checked in we were told that they had boiler problems and were moving us to their sister hotel in Paddington Court. Very angry with the situation we decided to move to this other hotel because we had no other options. We found the Paddington Court hotel to be very diasappointing. We had booked a deluxe double room in the original hotel and we were given a twin room with the beds no where near each other in the Paddington Court. The TV was tiny and very close to the bed, the shower and bathroom is tiny, and there is little or no space in the room. I went down to reception to say that this room is not what I had paid for and it was unacceptable. They showed us a double room on the 4th floor. The lift was broken so we would have to haul our case up another 3 flights of stairs, no thank you!! We said no to the room on the 4th floor and looked for another option. The girl at reception called us and said she had a clubroom on the same floor as us(the 1st floor). She sent someone up with a key for us to have a look at. We decided to take that room. It was no way a clubroom. It had a double bed with the same pokey bathroom!!! All in all we found it to be very disappointing. We will not be staying with Best Westerns again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowMarty
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune to find myself booking into the Best Western Hotel Paddington. The room was very small indeed- the flat screen tv was almost resting on the bed, the shower was so small that anyone slightly overweight would have difficulty opening the shower door ,once inside. The room was clean and tidy, but the overall view of the hotel with its very narrow corridors was very unclean. It is one of the poorest adverts that I have seen from Best Western hotel Group, U would now not use best western again. Marti

Reviews.Title: “Do not use this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scanning67
Reviews.Content: I should have read trip advisor first, these guys are terrible, do not use them! I booked a room on line and told them I would arrive late. I got there at 11pm as I told them only to be advises that they were full and could not accommodate me. All they could say was sorry! I gues they have a policy of over selling rooms hoping that not everyone will turn up. After much complaining, escalating and speaking to the manager they eventually agreed to book me into another hotel, the only gesture they would concede was to pay my taxi fare. Absoluely shocking customer service. I will never use best western again! You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, excellent location, needs good humour and patience”
Reviews.Author: CymraegBeirniaid
Reviews.Content: Trying to find luxurious, spacious rooms in the centres of the world's great cities for an affordable price is a thankless task. Basically it ends up as an exercise in managing expectations; and this stay was no different. I needed a hotel close to Paddington. I normally stay at the Hilton above the station but in these straitened times had to trim my budget. Others had mentioned the Paddington Court so, off I go and book through Laterooms for a price of Â£89, room only, including taxes - less than half the price of my normal home from home. I arrived in the early evening and knew this was going to be fun when the receptionist looked thoughtfully at my laterooms confirmation, paused and immediately called for help. My guess is that they had overbooked and the system had not found me. After a few minutes looking guilty, my helper told me "Don't worry - you have a good room - we have upgraded you - its big. Its over the road - in the basement". The Best Western has two properties adjacent. The Shaftesbury Hotel holds the reception, restaurant, bar, fitness area, kitchens, all the infrastructure. The three buildings across the road are called the Paddington Court Rooms and are accommodation only. I booked here because the theory is that you get a better room in return for sacrificing the convenience of having the amenities in the same building. My room was in building No 3 - room 652. If you are allocated 651, 652 or 653 you must remember to ask the staff for the climbing ropes and the crampons you will need to abseil down the almost vertical stairs to the underworld where these rooms are to be found. On a slightly more serious note, if your mobility is in any way compromised (new hip? Arthiritis? like me) these stairs can be a real challenge and you could really struggle if you had to manoeuver a suitcase or two at the same time. The hotel does not do itself any favours by leaving an area of the corridor wall 4' square by the bottom of these stairs damp and mouldy with peeled off wallpaper. They really should fix that quickly. That said - the room was adequate - larger than you would expect for this price (about 200 sq ft - no, don't gasp with horror - get over it - this is London) and was scrupulously clean with fresh bedding and excellent towels, which I would say were probably brand new. Now to the brickbats - the shower cubicle was great if you were aged 11 or below. I filled it completely. I could either stand in it while the water ran over me, or I could stand half in and half out while I moved arms and elbows to wash and turn and do my Frank Sinatra impressions. The handbasin was good to hold just that - one hand - and the loo was so close to the wall that you could only sit on it sideways. (That is the case in the newly refurbished rooms at the Hilton in New York as well, so maybe its the fashion these days...) The ethernet cable for wired internet was broken (the retaining lug was missing); there was no wifi in the basement (the hotel advertises free wifi in all rooms); the TV was broken (no pictures and it defeated the efforts of three members of staff to fix it or reboot it) so there was a bit of frustration circulating through my veins when I went out to find a local restaurant for an evening meal and a beer. When I returned the receptionist who checked me in was having a crafty cigarette on the pavement outside the hotel in a quiet moment. He could run but he could not hide, so I tackled him about these challenges. He was extremely pleasant and patient and did his best - but there is a limit to what you can do in his position when faced with a request to remodel a bathroom for a guest for a one night stay, so he offered me a free breakfast instead (a Â£14.95 extra worth about Â£3.99 on a good day). I gratefully accepted. The following morning when I checked out the staff were friendly and helpful and I left thinking that, for all of its faults, the location is just beyond criticism and, for Â£89 a night, it is still a good deal in London when the tourists are heading back to town. I have stayed in worse at double the cost. Will I return? Yes. Despite the challenges, this price range is notoriously difficult in London. if you want to spend Â£150 the choice is much better - but for less than Â£100 a night, this seems to me to be about as good as it gets.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst I have stayed in! Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: H11RYB
Reviews.Content: Booked double deluxe room in this 4 star hotel:- Very small. Mini-bar & snack cupboard empty,so a total waste of much needed space. Table for internet use blocked exit from one side of the bed-a real safety risk if you needed to go to the loo at night! Cigarette burns in the one very thin blanket on a very cold night. Lovely curtains blocked heat from radiator - if opened allowed anyone to seeinto the room as no blinds. Delivery in the street outside at 2.45 am-lasted around 35minutes & sounded like crates being stacked. An unpleasant stay!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Will not visit there again!

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: stingray_barb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was extremely disappointing. I arrived at reception to hear a client complaining about a toilet leaking into his room which made me nervous from the beginning. My room was tiny, barely enough room to put a bag down. The wardrobe was only about 20cm deep, so couldn't squeeze much in there either. The shower was also tiny - I couldn't wash my hair without my elbows hitting the shower walls. Fire alarms went off several times a day. Really loud maintenance work was going on all day. TV reception was terrible. They had advertised internet access via an interactive TV, but this was not available. There was one computer in the lounge that could be used, but there was always a queue for this. On the plus side, the room was clean and there was hot water. For the price, there must be better hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “terrible simply terrible”
Reviews.Author: bofgr61
Reviews.Content: I expected a small room but this was ridiculous!!!!!!!!!! I couldn't open my luggage anywhere in the room . There was blood & other human things on bedspread. Fire alarm went off 3 times while I was there,lifts dropped you at whatever floor it felt like. Appeared they were renovating they really need it. Would not recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here. It's AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: Shep01
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and two children stayed in this truly dreadul dump for three nights in mid-December 2006. We booked and paid for a room for the four of us, including breakfast. When we arrived in London after our long-haul flight from Australia, what did we find? A double bedroom with an old folding sofa bed wedged into it! The room was so small that the four of us and our bags did not physically fit in. After complaining to the manager (who had overdosed on his 'supercilious git' pills that morning) he agreed to provide another smaller room. This proved easier than it would seem, because the hotel we were staying at - the Allandale - had been taken over by the Best Western across the street, and was being renovated. Dust was everywhere, the smell was appalling and the second room was little more than a broom cupboard. Breakfast, we thought, would make things better - the famous full English breakfast. Now, we'd paid for it, but every morning the breakfast room staff ( none of whom seemed to speak English. Okay in Prague or Paris, NOT OK in London!) would try to stop us from eating, claiming we 'hadn't paid'. I would then be off to see the World's Snootiest Manager to (again, and again) point to our receipt with the words 'Breakfast included' printed in large letters. Breakfast would not commence for us until we had gone through this little charade, wasting about half an hour each morning. Bottom line : This place is an utter dump. Stay in Fawlty Towers before you stay here. Only extensive renovations, some soul-searching about room size and the wholesale sacking of everyone from the manager to the cleaner will save this miserable hole.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Pea2002
Reviews.Content: We booked the Allandale Hotel and paid a deposit, but turned up at the door to find someone who couldn't speak english pointing us across the road to the Best Western Paddington Court. We wandered across quite confused expecting some kind of enlightenment when we got there. But we were disappointed to find the lady on reception telling us we were in the wrong hotel. Eventually she consulted her supervisor and we were told that the Best Western had taken over the Allandale and we would be staying in the Paddington Court during our stay. On top of that they tried to charge us for the room again, even though we had pre-paid, and despite booking a triple room, and being told we would get a triple room when it was ready, we returned to the hotel to find a double room and had to be moved again. We were also told the bags would be taken to our room, but had to move them ourselves after the triple room was sorted out. I understand that meging two hotels must create some difficulty. But we were not informed of the take-over in advance, and weren't really offered any kind of gesture of apology after our plans were disrupted. The experience at BW Paddington Court was not what we were expecting at the independent Allandale, and it spoiled an otherwise enjoyable trip to London. I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very sad: There is no Allandale Hotel anymore”
Reviews.Author: Marion_29
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at the Allandale Hotel (nice, very clean room, charming atmosphere and friendly, caring hotel staff) - the first part of it anyway. Because during my stay, there was a change of management. The Allandale was bought by Best Western. I learned about this when I came - loaded with christmas shopping - back to the hotel one afternoon and workers were removing the "Allandale" signs at the doors. My nice room "Italy" was suddenly number 611 and there was a note on my bed, that the Allandale now belongs to the Best Western chain. They also changed the very nice duvet to a simple woolen blanket (Best Western standard!). After a horrible night (I was so cold under the thin blanket I even got the towels from the bathroom to wrap me up in) I went for breakfast in the Best Western Hotel opposite the street as I was supposed to do according to the note on my bed. It was a very different experience form the nice breakfasts at the Allandale Hotel I have had the days before. It was busy and chaotic. I waited ages for my tea (it really took me 20 minutes to get the attention of a staff member to order some tea - and then again 10 minutes to get some milk). The buffet was out of plates so people put there toasts in bowls. Also the qualtity of the food was very low. I mean: Yes, the breakfast selection at the Allandale was limited, but the eggs were fresh and cooked to your order and the jam tasted lovely. At the best western the eggs tasted dry and old (having been standing on the buffet for hours probpably) and the jam was very artifical. I very much liked the atmosphere at the Allandale breakfast (linen table cloth, lovely decoration etc.) - at the Best Western everything was just cheap and hectic. It is very sad, but under the new management of the Best Western Paddington Court the Allandale will become a part of a chain hotel with no indivdual charm at all. And I have only seen the first signs of it! At check-out (now at the Paddington Court hotel opposite the street) they ask for my room number and when I said "Italy" they looked at me like I just landed on the moon. And then they wanted to charged me a night to much. No problem here , mistakes happen - we sorted that out after a few minutes. But the way I was treated was not very polite or friendly. I am very sad, that just when I found this charming, affordable hotel with personal and caring service it is took over by a hotel chain (which is at the moment errating all indvidual touches).

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Paddington Court Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 3 Devonshire Terrace, London W2 3DN, England
